snippet: After the release of an army general captured by rebel fighters, the government of Colombia and the country’s largest guerrilla group said on Wednesday that they would soon resume peace talks.
abstract: Colombian government and Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia, or FARC, agree to resume peace talks following FARC's release of army general, Ruben Dario Alzate.

byline.contributor: Susan Abad contributed reporting from Bogotá, Colombia.

lead_paragraph: After the release of an army general captured by rebel fighters, the government of Colombia and the country’s largest guerrilla group said on Wednesday that they would soon resume peace talks.

headline.main: Colombia and Rebels Agree to Talks
headline.print_headline: Colombia and Rebels Agree to Talks
